description: Manage the rules of a URL path map.

commands.name: az network application-gateway url-path-map rule create
commands.summary: Create a rule for a URL path map.
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway url-path-map rule create --gateway-name
                                                        --name
                                                        --path-map-name
                                                        --paths
                                                        --resource-group
                                                        [--address-pool]
                                                        [--http-settings]
                                                        [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                        [--redirect-config]
                                                        [--rewrite-rule-set]
                                                        [--waf-policy]
examples: az network application-gateway url-path-map rule create -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway -n MyUrlPathMapRule2 --path-map-name MyUrlPathMap --paths /mypath2/* --address-pool MyAddressPool --http-settings MyHttpSettings

commands.name: az network application-gateway url-path-map rule delete
commands.summary: Delete a rule for a URL path map.
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway url-path-map rule delete --gateway-name
                                                        --name
                                                        --path-map-name
                                                        --resource-group
                                                        [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network application-gateway url-path-map rule delete -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway --path-map-name MyUrlPathMap -n MyUrlPathMapRule2

commands.name: az network application-gateway url-path-map rule wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway url-path-map rule wait [--created]
                                                      [--custom]
                                                      [--deleted]
                                                      [--exists]
                                                      [--gateway-name]
                                                      [--ids]
                                                      [--interval]
                                                      [--resource-group]
                                                      [--subscription]
                                                      [--timeout]
                                                      [--updated]
